1.brief: properly, to be erect (i.e. stand perpendicular); hence (causatively) to set up, in a great variety of applications, whether literal (establish, fix, prepare, apply), or figurative (appoint, render sure, proper or prosperous)
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
play upon it; to make music, accompanied by the voice; hence to celebrate in song and music
meaning accession (used as an adverb or conjunction); also or yea; adversatively though
properly, weight, but only figuratively in a good sense, splendor or copiousness

2.brief: a skin-bag for liquids (from collapsing when empty); hence, a vase (as similar in shape when full); also a lyre (as having a body of like form)

3.brief: physically, to throw (a stone, an arrow) at or away; especially to revere or worship (with extended hands); intensively, to bemoan (by wringing the hands)
a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
play upon it; to make music, accompanied by the voice; hence to celebrate in song and music
properly, a failure; by implication nothing; usually (adverb) not at all; also lest

4.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
great (in any sense); hence, older; also insolent
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
the sky (as aloft; the dual perhaps alluding to the visible arch in which the clouds move, as well as to the higher ether where the celestial bodies revolve)
kindness; by implication (towards God) piety; rarely (by opposition) reproof, or (subject.) beauty
as far (or long, or much) as, whether of space (even unto) or time (during, while, until) or degree (equally with)
a powder (as beaten small); by analogy, a thin vapor; by extension, the firmament

5.brief: to be high actively, to rise or raise (in various applications, literally or figuratively)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
the sky (as aloft; the dual perhaps alluding to the visible arch in which the clouds move, as well as to the higher ether where the celestial bodies revolve)

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
properly, weight, but only figuratively in a good sense, splendor or copiousness

6.brief: properly, heed, i.e. purpose; used only adverbially, on account of (as a motive or an aim), teleologically, in order that
to pull off; hence (intensively) to strip, (reflex.) to depart; by implication, to deliver, equip (for fight); present, strengthen
properly, to be open, wide or free, i.e. (by implication) to be safe; causatively, to free or succor
the right hand or side (leg, eye) of a person or other object (as the stronger and more dexterous); locally, the south
properly, to eye or (generally) to heed, i.e. pay attention; by implication, to respond; by extension to begin to speak; specifically to sing, shout, testify, announce

7.brief: gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
perhaps properly, to arrange; but used figuratively (of words), to speak; rarely (in a destructive sense) to subdue
a sacred place or thing; rarely abstract, sanctity
to jump for joy, i.e. exult
to be smooth (figuratively); by implication (as smooth stones were used for lots) to apportion or separate
Succoth, the name of a place in Egypt and of three in Palestine
properly, to stretch; by implication, to measure (as if by stretching a line); figuratively, to be extended

8.brief: Gilad, a region East of the Jordan; also the name of three Israelites
Menashsheh, a grandson of Jacob, also the tribe descended from him, and its territory
Ephrajim, a son of Joseph; also the tribe descended from him, and its territory
a fortified place; figuratively, a defence
the head (as most easily shaken), whether literal or figurative (in many applications, of place, time, rank, itc.)
Jehudah (or Judah), the name of five Israelites; also of the tribe descended from the first, and of its territory
properly, to hack, i.e. engrave (Judges 5:14, to be a scribe simply); by implication, to enact (laws being cut in stone or metal tablets in primitive times) or (gen.) prescribe

9.brief: Moab, an incestuous son of Lot; also his territory and descendants
a pot; also a thorn (as springing up rapidly); by implication, a hook
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
Edom, the elder twin-brother of Jacob; hence the region (Idumaea) occupied by him
to throw out, down or away (literally or figuratively)
properly, a sandal tongue; by extension a sandal or slipper (sometimes as a symbol of occupancy, a refusal to marry, or of something valueless)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
to mar (especially by breaking); figuratively, to split the ears (with sound), i.e. shout (for alarm or joy)

10.brief: who? (occasionally, by a peculiar idiom, of things); also (indefinitely) whoever; often used in oblique construction with prefix or suffix
properly, to flow; causatively, to bring (especially with pomp)
a city (a place guarded by waking or a watch) in the widest sense (even of a mere encampment or post)
a fortification, castle, or fortified city; figuratively, a defender
who? (occasionally, by a peculiar idiom, of things); also (indefinitely) whoever; often used in oblique construction with prefix or suffix
to guide; by implication, to transport (into exile, or as colonists)
as far (or long, or much) as, whether of space (even unto) or time (during, while, until) or degree (equally with)
Edom, the elder twin-brother of Jacob; hence the region (Idumaea) occupied by him

11.brief: not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to go (causatively, bring) out, in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively, direct and proxim.

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
a mass of persons (or figuratively, things), especially reg. organized forwar (an army); by implication, a campaign, literally or figuratively (specifically, hardship, worship)

12.brief: to give (whether literal or figurative); generally, to put; imperatively (reflexive) come
narrow; (as a noun) a tight place (usually figuratively, i.e. trouble); also a pebble ; (transitive) an opponent (as crowding)
evil (as destructive), literally (ruin) or morally (especially guile); figuratively idolatry (as false, subjective), uselessness (as deceptive, objective; also adverbially, in vain)
rescue (literal or figurative, persons, national or spiritual)
ruddy i.e. a human being (an individual or the species, mankind, etc.)

13.brief: gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
probably a force, whether of men, means or other resources; an army, wealth, virtue, valor, strength

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are
narrow; (as a noun) a tight place (usually figuratively, i.e. trouble); also a pebble ; (transitive) an opponent (as crowding)

14.brief: gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
probably a force, whether of men, means or other resources; an army, wealth, virtue, valor, strength

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are
narrow; (as a noun) a tight place (usually figuratively, i.e. trouble); also a pebble ; (transitive) an opponent (as crowding)
